availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
KENTON CIRCUIT COURT.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
To any Sheriff, Coroner, Jailor, Constable, Marshall, or Policeman in this State

You are hereby ^again^ commaded to Summon Josephine Stork to appear in the KENTON CIRCUIT COURT, at Covington on the first day of its next June Term, to answer an Indictment for a Misdemeanor found against him in said Court.

Given under my hand as Clerk of said Court, this 14 day of May 1862
N. B. Stephens Clerk K. C. C.
By A. C. Ellis D. C.
Copy att B W Foley Clk
By A C Ellis D C

No 562
COMMONWEALTH.
Against } Summons.
To June Term 1862 at Cov.
Arthur Atty's,
"Executed May 20, 1862 on Josephine Stork by giving her a copy of the within summons
J. S. Scott, D. S for S. F. Roberts, S. K. C
The within Deft's name is Storh instead of Stork,

Copy Att B W Foley Clk
By A C Ellis D C
